author: @WTOC11
title: Hundreds of Statesboro residents forced to vacate their homes at the Vault apartments
text:
Hundreds of Statesboro residents forced to vacate their homes at the Vault apartments
STATESBORO, Ga. (WTOC) - Hundreds of residents at The Vault apartments in Statesboro received a notice in the form of a letter on their doors on Monday saying that they had to vacate their homes by Friday.
Families and students have been moving out of their apartments since a letter was delivered to their doorsteps saying they had to vacate their homes due to the city deeming the apartments on the property to be structurally unsafe.
A few residents told WTOC they don‚Äôt have anywhere to go and that they can‚Äôt afford to stay in a hotel this short notice.
‚ÄúSo, where does that leave everybody else? Homeless.‚Äù
Others say they didn‚Äôt learn that they had to move out until today.
‚ÄúShe texted me and she said what are you going to do for housing? I said what are you talking about and she said The Vault is closing.‚Äù
Georgia Southern student Christina Colley says she‚Äôs lucky because she is a senior at Georgia Southern and was moving out soon anyway.
However, she says she has made several complaints to management in the past about her apartment.
‚ÄúThe second year my lease started, it just went so downhill and even if you ask management to come fix something, they didn‚Äôt. They would be like we don‚Äôt have management right now, so it‚Äôs been going downhill ever since the second year I started my lease.‚Äù
In the letter The Vault management gave residents, it says the city of Statesboro asked them to vacate every resident.
However, in the letter issued by the city to The Vault, it states that the apartment complex has ten days to come up with a plan or actions to fix the apartment buildings.
The city of Statesboro was prompted to send this letter after inspections were done by engineering consultants deemed the buildings to be unsafe and too deteriorated for healthy living.
Different resources in the Statesboro community have reached out to aid the residents with different open housing options, temporary free healthcare, and different options for free meals.
WTOC reached out to the Vault management who declined to comment.
Copyright 2025 WTOC. All rights reserved.

author: @AusSMC
title: Ancient Thai teeth show we've been getting a buzz from betel nuts for at least 4,000 years
text:
Media release
From:
4,000-year-old teeth record the earliest traces of people chewing psychoactive betel nuts
New methods make the ‚Äòinvisible visible‚Äô to find evidence of deeply rooted cultural practice which otherwise might have been lost in the archaeological record
Humans have used psychoactive plants for their narcotic effects for thousands of years. Throughout Thailand, remains of betel nuts, plants used for their stimulant effects, have been discovered at burial sites. To learn more about the practice, an international team of researchers have examined 4,000-year-old teeth and found traces of compounds from betel nuts. This indicates that betel nut chewing has been practiced for thousands of years, if not more, in the country. The study is the first to detect ‚Äòarchaeologically invisible‚Äô cues in dental plaque, revealing ancient behaviors and practices that otherwise could have been lost to time.
In south-east Asia, betel nut chewing has been practiced since antiquity. The plants contain compounds that enhance the consumer‚Äôs alertness, energy, euphoria, and relaxation. Although the practice is becoming less common in modern times, it has been deeply embedded in social and cultural traditions for thousands of years. Chewing betel nuts typically results in dark, reddish-brown to black stained teeth.
Yet, teeth without staining may not mean that people didn‚Äôt chew betel nuts. Now, using a new method, an international team of researchers examined ancient dental plaque from Bronze Age Thailand and found evidence of betel nut chewing.
‚ÄúWe identified plant derivatives in dental calculus from a 4,000-year-old burial at Nong Ratchawat, Thailand,‚Äù said first author of the Frontiers in Environmental Archaeology study Dr Piyawit Moonkham, an anthropological archaeologist at Chiang Mai University in Thailand. ‚ÄúThis is the earliest direct biomolecular evidence of betel nut use in south-east Asia.‚Äù
‚ÄúWe demonstrate that dental calculus can preserve chemical signatures of psychoactive plant use for millennia, even when conventional archaeological evidence is completely absent,‚Äù added Dr Shannon Tushingham, the senior author, who is the associate curator of anthropology at the California Academy of Sciences. ‚ÄúIn essence, we‚Äôve developed a way to make the invisible visible‚Äîrevealing behaviors and practices that have been lost to time for 4,000 years.‚Äù
Hidden in plaque
At Nong Ratchawat, an archaeological site in central Thailand that dates back to the Bronze Age, 156 human burials have been unearthed since 2003. For the present study, the team collected 36 dental calculus samples from six individuals.
Back in the lab, they removed tiny amounts of plaque from the samples and the chemical residues found therein underwent analysis. The team also used betel liquid samples they produced themselves to ensure psychoactive compounds could be reliably detected through their analysis and to understand the complex biochemical interactions between ingredients. ‚ÄúWe used dried betel nut, pink limestone paste, Piper betel leaves, and sometimes Senegalia catechu bark and tobacco. We ground the ingredients with human saliva to replicate authentic chewing conditions,‚Äù Moonkham said. ‚ÄúSourcing materials and experimentally ‚Äòchewing‚Äô betel nuts to create authentic quid samples was both a fun and interesting process.‚Äù
The results showed that three of the archaeological samples ‚Äì all stemming from a molar of the same individual, Burial 11 ‚Äì contained traces of arecoline and arecaidine. These organic compounds, found in betel nuts but also plants like coffee, tea, and tobacco, have pronounced physiological effects on humans. This suggests that betel nuts were chewed as early as 4,000 years ago in Thailand.
‚ÄòArchaeologically invisible‚Äô proof
‚ÄúThe presence of betel nut compounds in dental calculus does suggest repeated consumption, as these residues become incorporated into mineralized plaque deposits over time through regular exposure,‚Äù explained Tushingham. Accordingly, the absence of tooth-staining raises questions. It could be the result of different consumption methods, the team pointed out. It could also be due to post-consumption teeth cleaning practices, or post-mortem processes affecting stain preservation over 4,000 years.
While traces of betel nut chewing were found in samples from only one individual, there is currently no proof that Burial 11 received special treatment or was of elevated social status or unique ritual significance compared to the other burials at Nong Ratchawat. The presence of stone beads as grave goods, however, could provide hints as to the individual's identity or lived experience. Studying more individuals at Nong Ratchawat and other local sites to learn when and to whom such grave goods were given could provide valuable evidence, the team said.
The methods the researchers applied can be used to examine the remaining burials at Nong Ratchawat and at other sites, they said. ‚ÄúDental calculus analysis can reveal behaviors that leave no traditional archaeological traces, potentially revolutionizing our understanding of ancient lifeways and human-plant relationships,‚Äù Tushingham said. ‚ÄúIt could open new windows into the deep history of human cultural practices.‚Äù
‚ÄúUnderstanding the cultural context of traditional plant use is a larger theme we want to amplify‚Äîpsychoactive, medicinal, and ceremonial plants are often dismissed as drugs, but they represent millennia of cultural knowledge, spiritual practice, and community identity,‚Äù Moonkham concluded. ‚ÄúArchaeological evidence can inform contemporary discussions by honoring the deep cultural heritage behind these practices.‚Äù

author: Diego Guadalupe
title: Por qu√© Bitcoin y Ethereum terminar√°n 2023 con fuerza
text: Por qu√© Bitcoin y Ethereum terminar√°n 2023 con fuerza - La acci√≥n del precio de BTC y ETH este a√±o fue una de las mejores del siglo. - BTC mostr√≥ debilidad, lo que sugiere una ca√≠da por debajo de $43,000, mientras que ETH puede avanzar hacia $2,500. [Bitcoins [BTC]](https://ambcrypto.com/search/bitcoin) y [Etereum [ETH]](https://ambcrypto.com/search/ethereum) Las actuaciones en 2023 pasar√≠an a ser consideradas una de las mejores de la historia del siglo, seg√∫n revel√≥ una publicaci√≥n de Santiment. Al momento de esta publicaci√≥n, BTC hab√≠a podido recuperar $43,000. ETH, en el otro extremo, se dispar√≥ y cambi√≥ de manos a 2.380 d√≥lares. La herramienta de an√°lisis criptogr√°fico, en su publicaci√≥n, tambi√©n mencion√≥ que ETH y BTC poseen la capacidad de alcanzar sus valores m√°s altos antes de que termine el a√±o. ü•≥üìä 2023 est√° pasando a los libros como uno de los a√±os de mejor desempe√±o del siglo, representando m√∫ltiples sectores importantes. [#Bitcoin]y [#Etereum]todav√≠a est√°n al alcance de superar los m√°ximos de m√°s de 1,5 a√±os, que se establecieron hace apenas 3 semanas. [https://t.co/JxbW5vU5Iy] [pic.twitter.com/aLSGX5U2Vv] ‚Äì Sentimiento (@santimentfeed) [27 de diciembre de 2023] Despu√©s del brillo, viene la fiesta. A principios de a√±o, el mercado de las criptomonedas estaba luchando por recuperarse del colapso de FTX que hizo caer los precios. Durante ese tiempo, el valor de BTC era inferior a 17.000 d√≥lares, mientras que ETH cotizaba un poco por encima de 1.200 d√≥lares. El ascenso de Bitcoin y Ethereum fue impulsado por diferentes razones. Pero alrededor del primer trimestre (Q1), la raz√≥n principal fue el colapso de algunas de las principales instituciones tradicionales en los EE.UU. El colapso de los bancos en ese momento desencaden√≥ desconfianza en las instituciones. A su vez, el mercado de criptomonedas liderado por Ethereum y Bitcoin se benefici√≥ de la liquidez retirada, ya que tambi√©n afect√≥ en buena medida a los precios. Si bien hubo otras razones para el continuo aumento de precios, la influencia notable que ha mantenido a ambas monedas en el lado verde es el optimismo en torno a un [potencial](https://ambcrypto.com/grayscale-files-revised-application-for-bitcoin-spot-etf-details-here/) ETF al contado. Durante la mayor parte del a√±o, varias empresas han solicitado un ETF de Ethereum o Bitcoin. En unos pocos casos, algunas empresas solicitaron ambos. Estas solicitudes, a pesar de haber sido retrasadas por la SEC estadounidense, influyeron en las entradas de inversiones. En muchas ocasiones, AMBCrypto [revelado](https://ambcrypto.com/crypto-fund-inflows-surpass-2022-numbers-in-6-weeks/) Aumentos en el dinero que fluye hacia productos de inversi√≥n conectados a Bitcoin y Ethereum. Las entradas indicaron que varias instituciones confiaban en el desempe√±o a corto y largo plazo de las criptomonedas. Por lo tanto, no fue sorprendente que BTC registrara un aumento del 159% en lo que va del a√±o (YTD). ETH tambi√©n sigui√≥ subiendo un 98%. En los √∫ltimos d√≠as, hay predicciones de que las monedas podr√≠an terminar el a√±o a√∫n mejor. Alcistas y osos se apresurar√°n por el gran premio Para Bitcoin, el gr√°fico diario mostr√≥ que hab√≠a un fuerte soporte en $42,279. Sin embargo, el soporte en el nivel no fue una confirmaci√≥n de una tendencia alcista. AMBCrypto evalu√≥ la divergencia de convergencia de media m√≥vil (MACD), que fue negativa. El MACD negativo indic√≥ un creciente impulso bajista. Adem√°s, el √≠ndice de fuerza relativa (RSI) confirm√≥ el sesgo cuando la lectura cay√≥ a 54,52. Si esta tendencia contin√∫a, Bitcoin podr√≠a terminar el a√±o por debajo de los 43.000 d√≥lares. Sin embargo, el gr√°fico anterior tambi√©n muestra el volumen en equilibrio (OBV) que estaba aumentando. El aumento del OBV refleja una presi√≥n de volumen positiva que podr√≠a conducir a precios m√°s altos. Si la presi√≥n de compra aumenta justo antes de que termine el a√±o, BTC podr√≠a alcanzar los 45.000 d√≥lares. Si no, un [hacia abajo](https://ambcrypto.com/is-bitcoin-due-for-a-price-correction/) moverse por debajo de $ 43,000 podr√≠a ser su pr√≥ximo objetivo. Mientras tanto, el gr√°fico de 4 horas del ETH/USD refleja una estructura alcista. El 27 de diciembre, ETH hab√≠a superado la resistencia de 2290 d√≥lares. Pero el precio de la moneda enfrent√≥ un r√°pido rechazo despu√©s de alcanzar los $2,415, lo que sugiere que hab√≠a un grupo de acumulaci√≥n en ese nivel. Aunque la volatilidad aument√≥, la banda superior de las Bandas de Bollinger (BB) alcanz√≥ el precio de ETH. Esto sugiere que la altcoin estaba sobrecomprada y el precio puede retroceder a√∫n m√°s. Pero al observar el √çndice de Movimiento Direccional (DMI), la historia fue diferente. Realista o no, aqu√≠ est√° [La capitalizaci√≥n de mercado de ETH en t√©rminos de BTC](https://ambcrypto.com/calculator/marketcap) En el momento de esta edici√≥n, el +DMI (verde) era 33,92 mientras que el -DMI (rojo) era 16,35. Esta posici√≥n implicaba que las tendencias alcistas de ETH segu√≠an siendo presi√≥n. Si el √≠ndice direccional promedio (ADX), de color amarillo, permanece por encima de 25 mientras el +DMI supera el -DMI, entonces ETH puede volver a probar $2,415 o [saltar](https://ambcrypto.com/ethereum-why-a-big-eth-move-to-2-5k-might-be-imminent/) a $2,500 antes de que cierre el a√±o.

author: Alberto Zamora
title: Enviar medicinas en avi√≥n y helic√≥ptero, absurdo y car√≠simo: X√≥chitl G√°lvez | MVS Noticias
text: La precandidata presidencial del PAN, PRI y PRD, [X√≥chitl G√°lvez](https://mvsnoticias.com/nacional/2023/12/27/estados-unidos-debe-aportar-recursos-para-crisis-migratoria-xochitl-galvez-620176.html) asegur√≥ que la mega farmacia del gobierno de M√©xico no es necesaria, sino que los medicamentos lleguen a las 190 mil localidades del pa√≠s. En un video difundido en redes sociales, el cual fue grabado afuera del predio donde se ubica la mega farmacia, G√°lvez Ruiz dijo que enviar medicinas en avi√≥n y helic√≥ptero ‚Äúes car√≠simo y absurdo‚Äù. Cuestion√≥ que se pretenda enviar medicamentos desde Huehuetoca hasta la Monta√±a de Guerrero, cuando lo que se necesita es garantizar la distribuci√≥n. Te podr√≠a interesar ‚ÄúC√≥mo va a llegar un medicamento de urgencia desde aqu√≠, Huehuetoca, Estado de M√©xico hasta un enfermo en Tijuana, M√©rida o en la Monta√±a de Guerrero; no juegue con la salud del pueblo, presidente‚Äù, afirm√≥. La aspirante presidencial de la coalici√≥n Fuerza y Coraz√≥n por M√©xico propuso acabar con el desabasto de medicinas en M√©xico y garantiz√≥ que su objetivo es que haya un gobierno que le diga la verdad a los ciudadanos y d√© soluciones a los problemas, porque ‚Äúel pueblo merece salud‚Äù.
